content: Plants vs. Zombies 2's .OBB files contain a variety of game assets, including images, sounds, in-game text, and animations. The animations that Plants vs. Zombies 2's OBB files contain are saved as PAM files.

While Plants vs. Zombies 2 enthusiasts have developed tools that allow them to extract and edit a variety of the game's proprietary files (including .RTON, .RSB, and .PTX files), they have not yet developed any tools that can extract or edit PAM files. PAM files are also used in other PopCap Games games, such as Bookworm Adventures.

description: A PAM file is an animation used by a PopCap Games video game, such as Plants vs. Zombies 2. It contains binary data used to show an animation in a game. PAM files cannot be opened or edited.

instructions: There is currently no way to open or edit a PAM (PopCap Games Animation) file outside of Plants Vs. Zombies 2.
